alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:41AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Kanawha, central Lincoln and northwestern Boone Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 341 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spurlockville, or 8 miles south of Hamlin, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Gill, Spurlockville, Julian, Alum Creek, Danville, Sweetland, Sod, Woodville, Palermo, Foster, Griffithsville, Alkol, Mud, Yawkey, Myra and Ashford. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 48 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
